1983 The Linda F. Segal collection of Brooklyn Bridge Centennial records contains press packets, memorabilia, and news clippings relating to the celebration.
Conditions Governing Access
Open to researchers without restriction.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of Linda F. Segal, 2017.
Arrangement
Material has been grouped by subject type and arranged alphabetically.
Biographical / Historical
Linda F. Segal was the press agent for the Brooklyn Bridge Centennial Celebration, 1883-1983, planned by The 1983 Brooklyn Bridge Centennial Commission, Inc.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); Linda F. Segal collection of Brooklyn Bridge Centennial records, 2017.024, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
Processing Information
Records were housed in acid free folders and boxes. Folder titles were supplied by the archivist.
Related Materials
The Brooklyn Historical Society holds the following related collections: Brooklyn Bridge centennial celebration collection, 1983 (1994 015) Brooklyn Bridge Construction records, 1873-1879 (1977 259) Brooklyn Bridge golden anniversary dinner seating list, 1933 (1992 002) Brooklyn Bridge photographs, c.1890-1930 (V1986 249) Brooklyn Daily Eagle issue announcing the opening of the Brooklyn Bridge, 1883 (1985 018) Brooklyn Historical Society Newspaper collection, 1783- (ARC 258) Joseph Hess collection of Brooklyn Bridge photographs, c. 20th century (V1990 064)
Scope and Contents
The Linda F. Segal collection of Brooklyn Bridge Centennial records contains news releases, invitations, pamphlets, programs, souvenir books, newspaper and magazine articles, and a catalog for The Great East River Bridge show at The Brooklyn Museum. All of the materials relate to the celebrations associated with the Brooklyn Bridge centennial. The press materials, pamphlets, and souvenir books contain extensive information on the various events which comprised the Brooklyn Bridge Centennial Celebration. The invitations, pamphlets, and museum exhibition catalog document associated events. The press clippings include a reprint of the May 24, 1883, issue of The New York Times which included an article on the bridge's opening ceremony.
Conditions Governing Use
The Brooklyn Historical Society does not hold copyright to materials in this collection. Permission to publish or reproduce must be secured from the copyright holder.
Appraisal
Duplicate materials, clippings, and mass market publications were removed from the collection.
